intro: Aquilegia silvestris, commonly known as the wild columbine, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features distinctive spurred petals that resemble small horns, which are characteristic of the Ranunculaceae family. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with basal leaves that are palmately divided. Its flowers, which bloom in spring, come in shades of blue, purple, and white, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Aquilegia silvestris thrives in woodland or shady areas and prefers moist, well-drained soil.
